item.title: Delays Creating / Modifying Clusters in the Azure "East US 2" Region
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Azure Compute Resource Provisioning Issue in "East US 2" Region

Azure is experiencing an issue provisioning compute resources in the "East US 2" region, causing delays for customers creating or modifying clusters with nodes in this region. Users may experience prolonged "blue bar" delays. Monitoring ongoing.

Feb 28, 16:28 UTC
Identified - Azure is experiencing an issue provisioning compute resources in the "East US 2" region. As a result, customers creating or modifying clusters with nodes in Azure "East US 2" may experience delays. Users may experience delays with the "blue bar" persisting longer than normal.

We are monitoring this issue closely and will provide an update when more information is available.

item.title: MongoDB Cloud: Unable to create new Identity Providers for Federated Authentication
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Issue with creating new Identity Providers for Federated Authentication Summary: The company is aware of reports of issues with creating new Identity Providers for Federated Authentication and is working to fix the problem. Existing federations are unaffected.

Feb 23, 16:49 UTC
Identified - We are currently aware of reports that creating new Identity Providers for Federated Authentication is failing. The fix has been identified and we're working with our upstream provider on implementing a fix.

Existing federations are unaffected.

item.title: Increased error rate in App Services Functions using deprecated 3rd Party Services
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Users accessing 3rd Party Services in App Services Functions

Summary: Users accessing 3rd Party Services in App Services Functions between 2:00PM EST and 4:30PM EST in Mumbai, APAC, and Europe regions may have experienced a higher rate of errors. The cause of the issue has been identified and resolved.

Feb 21, 20:00 UTC
Resolved - Users accessing 3rd Party Services in App Services Functions between 2:00PM EST and 4:30PM EST in Mumbai, APAC, and Europe regions may have experienced a higher rate of errors. The cause of the issue has been identified and resolved.

item.title: Chat support is currently unavailable
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Chat Support Unavailability Summary: Chat support is currently unavailable, but Atlas clusters are not impacted. Investigation ongoing.

Feb 22, 10:52 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Feb 22, 10:47 UTC
Investigating - Chat support is currently unavailable, please standby while we work on the issue. Atlas clusters are not impacted

item.title: cloud.mongodb.com slow response times
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Slow Response Times at cloud.mongodb.com

Summary: Users experienced slow response times and login issues at cloud.mongodb.com. Changes to Atlas Clusters had short delays, but there was no impact to running Atlas Clusters.

Feb 17, 07:39 UTC
Resolved - Slow response times began around 6:27 UTC and end around 6:47 AM UTC. During this time, users may have experienced issues logging in to cloud.mongodb.com and slow response times from the Atlas Administrative API. Requests for changes to Atlas Clusters including adding new IPs to the Access List experienced short delays in processing. There was no impact to running Atlas Clusters.

Feb 17, 06:56 UTC
Monitoring - We have identified the issue, stabilized the system and are monitoring the results.

Feb 17, 06:41 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating reports of slow response times for cloud.mongodb.com.

Users may experience difficulties logging in to cloud.mongodb.com, and slow response times from the Atlas Administrative API. Requests for changes to Atlas Clusters including adding new IPs to the Access List may experience a delay in processing.

There is no impact to running Atlas Clusters.

item.title: Atlas Cluster Operations Delayed
item.content:encoded:
Feb 16, 11:46 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 16, 11:32 UTC
Monitoring - The remediation has been completed and we are monitoring the results.

Feb 16, 11:19 UTC
Identified - A small subset of customers using AWS regions may experience delays with operations to their clusters. The issue started at approximately 0120 UTC. The issue has already been identified and a remediation is in progress.

item.title: Increased Atlas Data Federation and Online Archive query latency
item.content:encoded:
Feb 13, 17:47 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 13, 14:52 UTC
Update - Atlas Data Federation and Online Archive is back to being operational and stable.

Feb 13, 14:49 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring results.

Feb 13, 14:23 UTC
Investigating - Users of Atlas Data Federation and Online Archive may see increased query latency for some queries.

item.title: Increased Atlas Data Federation and Online Archive query latency in us-east-1
item.content:encoded:
Feb 12, 23:26 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 12, 23:15 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Feb 12, 20:18 UTC
Investigating - Users of Atlas Data Federation and Online Archive may see increased query latency for some queries in us-east-1.

item.title: Unable to create new Identity Providers for Federated Authentication
item.content:encoded:
Feb 11, 03:40 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 11, 02:11 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Feb 9, 18:18 UTC
Identified - The fix has been identified and we're working with our upstream provider on implementing a fix.

Feb 9, 14:49 UTC
Investigating - We are currently aware of reports that creating new Identity Providers for Federated Authentication is failing. We are investigating this issue.

item.title: Changes to Atlas Serverless Instances Delayed
item.content:encoded:
Jan 26, 22:28 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 26, 20:35 UTC
Monitoring - We have implemented a fix and is observing that the system is recovering.

Jan 26, 18:39 UTC
Identified - We have identified an issue that is causing delays to modification requests to Atlas Serverless instances across multiple regions. This includes creation of new instances and deletion of existing instances. The instances themselves should continue to be fully available and responsive to queries. We are working toward remediation and will provide updates as we have more information.

item.title: Azure Cluster Operatons Delayed
item.content:encoded:
Jan 21, 12:39 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 21, 04:37 UTC
Identified - Due to an Azure Resource Manager outage in some regions, customers will experience delays performing operations on Azure Clusters.

Please see https://azure.status.microsoft/en-us/status for details.

item.title: Atlas operations and Cloud Manager metrics collection delayed
item.content:encoded:
Jan 18, 14:08 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 18, 00:05 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Jan 18, 00:04 UTC
Monitoring - The system has recovered and we are continuing to monitor.

Jan 17, 23:56 UTC
Update - The system is largely recovered, but we are monitoring closely. Issues experienced by some customers connecting to Atlas Shared Tier or Atlas Serverless clusters were resolved around 23:00 UTC.

Connections to Atlas Dedicated clusters and performance of Atlas Dedicated clusters are not and have not been impacted.

Jan 17, 23:20 UTC
Update - The system is starting to recover.
- Issues connecting to Atlas Shared Tier and Atlas Serverless Clusters should be resolved.
- Metrics for some Atlas Serverless Clusters may still be delayed
- Creation of new Atlas clusters is experiencing a delay due to a delay in DNS propagation
- User-initiated requests for changes to Atlas clusters are processing in a timely manner with the exception of changes that require new DNS entries (e.g. adding a new node)

Connections to Atlas Dedicated clusters and performance of Atlas Dedicated clusters are not and have not been impacted.

Jan 17, 23:13 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jan 17, 20:46 UTC
Update - We are continuing to see delays in metrics for Atlas Shared Tier and Atlas Serverless clusters. Additionally all modifications for the Atlas Clusters are delayed including creation of new clusters/instances, ip access list, and user changes. We have also identified an issue with connections to some Atlas Shared Tier and Atlas Serverless clusters.

Jan 17, 17:20 UTC
Update - We are continuing to delays in metrics for Atlas Shared Tier and Atlas Serverless clusters. Additionally all modifications for the Atlas Shared Tier clusters and Atlas Serverless instances are delayed including creation of new clusters/instances, ip access list, and user changes. For Atlas Dedicated clusters, user requested changes to Atlas clusters (modifying the Network Access list, adding an additional node in a replica set, adding a new Database User, etc.) are being processed in a timely manner. However, scheduled actions such as snapshots are experiencing delays. The delay for scheduled actions is currently decreasing.

Jan 17, 15:02 UTC
Update - Metrics for Atlas Shared Tier and Atlas Serverless clusters are still experiencing delays. User requested changes to Atlas clusters (modifying the Network Access list, adding an additional node in a replica set, adding a new Database User, etc.) are being processed in a timely manner. However, scheduled actions such as snapshots are experiencing delays.

Jan 17, 13:33 UTC
Update - We have partially remediated the issue. However, metrics for Atlas Shared Tier and Atlas Serverless clusters are still experiencing delays. Changes to Atlas clusters (including IP Access List modifications, topology and tier changes, or the creation of new clusters) may still be experiencing some delays.

Jan 17, 12:07 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. No root cause or remediation has been reached at this time.

Jan 17, 11:03 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. No root cause or remediation has been reached at this time.

Jan 17, 09:07 UTC
Update - Atlas clusters may show as Degraded due to the delayed metrics data - however, there is no impact to the clusters themselves. (This is a false positive.) There may be a delay processing requested changes to Atlas clusters.

Jan 17, 08:33 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating an issue delaying the processing of metrics points for Atlas and Cloud Manager.

item.title: MongoDB Atlas: Cluster creation, deletion, and modification delayed
item.content:encoded:
Jan 18, 00:05 UTC
Resolved - This issue has been resolved.

Jan 16, 20:39 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 16, 18:03 UTC
Identified - We have identified an issue delaying certain cluster modifications. Specifically, creating, deleting, modifying the count of nodes in a cluster, or certain maintenance operations that may do these things is presently delayed.

MongoDB operations on clusters, as well as cluster health is unaffected.

item.title: MongoDB Charts: Charts failing to load
item.content:encoded:
Jan 10, 23:16 UTC
Resolved - We have deployed a fix. MongoDB Charts is operational again.

Jan 10, 21:15 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating reports of MongoDB Charts pages not loading. Affected users will see a "Status 500" message or "MongoDB Charts cannot be loaded".

item.title: MongoDB Atlas App Services and Device Sync APIs refusing connections in us-west-2 (AWS)
item.content:encoded:
Jan 10, 14:26 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 10, 04:30 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 10, 03:46 UTC
Identified - Atlas App Services and Device Sync users may see intermittent connection errors when connecting to apps in the us-west-2 region on AWS.

item.title: Atlas Charts: charts.mongodb.com was unavailable
item.content:encoded:
Jan 9, 01:04 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 9, 00:18 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented, and we are monitoring the results.

item.title: MongoDB Atlas Search: Atlas search index modification unavailable
item.content:encoded:
Dec 20, 00:14 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 19, 23:55 UTC
Monitoring - We have deployed the fix to remediate the issue for all affected clusters and are monitoring for any further issues.

Dec 19, 23:20 UTC
Identified - We have identified the root cause of the issue. We have remediated the issue for already affected clusters, and are currently rolling out a fix for clusters that may be impacted by the issue. Some customers may continue to experience intermittent issues until the fix has been fully deployed.

Dec 19, 20:05 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating an issue affecting MongoDB Atlas Search. Affected clusters will be unable to create or modify Atlas Search indexes. These index delays may cause new index builds to fail and stale search query results to be returned for already built indexes. This does not affect all Atlas Search clusters.

item.title: MongoDB Atlas for Government: "no healthy upstream" error during login
item.content:encoded:
Dec 18, 20:04 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 18, 19:59 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Dec 18, 19:56 UTC
Identified - We have identified the issue causing Atlas for Government logins to fail with the error message "no healthy upstream" and are working on a fix.

Cluster health and non-Atlas-for-Government environments remain unaffected.

Dec 18, 19:43 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating an issue causing users logging into MongoDB Atlas For Government to get a blank page with the text "no healthy upstream"

Cluster health is unaffected. This does not affect non-Atlas-for-Government environments.

item.title: MongoDB Atlas GitHub Login Issues
item.content:encoded:
Dec 18, 18:05 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 18, 18:00 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Dec 18, 17:06 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Dec 18, 17:06 UTC
Investigating - We're currently aware that logging into MongoDB Atlas via GitHub is not functioning as expected.

item.title: MongoDB Atlas Login Issues
item.content:encoded:
Dec 17, 03:22 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 16, 22:23 UTC
Monitoring - We are experiencing an increase in login attempts resulting in issues for customers attempting to log in to Atlas and our Support Portal. Please try again in a few minutes if you are still having trouble logging in.

item.title: MongoDB Atlas App Services and Device Sync APIs refusing connections
item.content:encoded:
Dec 14, 15:00 UTC
Resolved - Atlas App Services and Device Sync users may have experienced refused connections and/or general API increased latency between 15:10 UTC and 15:50 UTC. This was primarily limited to deployments in AWS regions. This issue has been resolved.

item.title: Atlas Data Federation and Online Archive users may see internal errors when querying Atlas cluster data sources in AWS/ap-southeast-1
item.content:encoded:
Nov 20, 19:25 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 20, 18:56 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Nov 20, 16:47 UTC
Identified - Atlas Data Federation and Online Archive users may see internal errors when querying Atlas cluster data sources in AWS/ap-southeast-1.

item.title: App Services Triggers in eu-central saw degraded performance
item.content:encoded:
Nov 18, 18:09 UTC
Resolved - Atlas App Services: Some Atlas Triggers experienced delays in processing

There was an internal networking error that caused this. All of the triggers impacted were restarted.

item.title: Atlas Data Federation, Online Archive, App Services & Device Sync users may see internal errors when querying Atlas cluster data sources in AWS/ap-southeast-1
item.content:encoded:
Nov 17, 17:27 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.


Atlas App Services & Device Sync:
Some Atlas Triggers & Sync workloads experienced unexpected suspensions
There was an internal networking error that caused some them to suspend. All of the workloads impacted were restarted

Nov 17, 17:19 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Nov 17, 17:13 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Nov 17, 16:56 UTC
Investigating - Users of Atlas Data Federation and Online Archive may see an increase in queries failed due to internal errors when querying Atlas cluster data sources in AWS/ap-southeast-1.

item.title: Scheduled Cluster Operation Delays
item.content:encoded:
Nov 16, 00:37 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 15, 22:34 UTC
Monitoring - Due to an earlier incident, customers may experience delays in scheduled operations such as backups and auto scaling. Cluster create and update operations are not impacted.

The issue has been remediated, and the system is recovering. All scheduled operations are expected to complete successfully without issue.

item.title: MongoDB Cloud, MongoDB Support Portal: Login failures
item.content:encoded:
Nov 15, 23:28 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 15, 23:13 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Nov 15, 22:35 UTC
Update - We have identified an issue with logins affecting all users of MongoDB Atlas, MongoDB Cloud Manager, and the MongoDB Support Portal. Specifically, new logins will fail. Existing sessions are unaffected. Users are encouraged to use API keys and/or wait until this is resolved.

Existing cluster health is unaffected.

Nov 15, 22:02 UTC
Identified - We have identified an issue with logins affecting all users of MongoDB Atlas, MongoDB Cloud Manager, and the MongoDB Support Portal. Specifically, new logins will fail. Existing sessions are unaffected. Users are encouraged to use API keys and/or wait until this is resolved.

Existing cluster health is unaffected.

item.title: Atlas App Services: some Atlas Triggers experienced unexpected suspensions
item.content:encoded:
Nov 9, 16:00 UTC
Resolved - There was an internal networking error that caused some Atlas Triggers to suspend. All of the triggers impacted were restarted.

item.title: Atlas Data Federation Query Failures
item.content:encoded:
Nov 5, 21:41 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 5, 21:39 UTC
Update - The system is back to a healthy state.

Nov 5, 21:25 UTC
Monitoring - The fix has been implemented and is now being monitored.

The issue affected queries against Online Archives and Data Lake Snapshots in AWS/us-east-1.

Nov 5, 20:41 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Nov 5, 19:59 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating increased query errors with Atlas Data Federation in AWS/us-east-1.

Users may notice increased occurrences of queries failing with internal errors.

item.title: MongoDB Cloud status page new domain name
item.content:encoded:
Nov 2, 20:16 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Nov 2, 20:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Nov 2, 19:59 UTC
Scheduled - At this time we have changed the canonical home for this status page from status.cloud.mongodb.com to status.mongodb.com (removed "cloud"). Existing subscriptions (e.g. Slack, SMS, webhook) will be unaffected. RSS subscribers are encouraged to use the new URL as soon as feasible, but a redirect will be available for an indefinite amount of time.

Cluster health, the support portal, or any other MongoDB Cloud services are unaffected.
